divs: Sighting DetailsWas talking to a friend on the telephone & walked out in the back yard. I always like to take a look to see if I can see the moon before turning in. Finished call & saw the moon as big as its ever been but saw a lot more. A large bright white light in the southern sky - a light far brighter and bigger than any of the stars. It wasn't moving. Called a friend and drove to the Butler University campus where they have an Observatory. All was quiet on campus & Observatory appeared to be locked up tight. Object in sky could be seen even better through my binoculars. It was sitting in the same spot & never moved. Went back home & checked it every couple minutes for an hour until the mosquitoes got too bad & called it a night. Friend in Hamilton County who lives in country setting could see it far better without city lights. She said she had seen it last night also.
trends: There have been 126 other sightings in Indianapolis
There was one other sighting in Indianapolis on or around August 9th 2009
Summary: Huge bright white shape in southern sky
